channel.title: Jittery secondary monitor
channel.description:
I just got a new 25" 1920x1080 monitor. My old 19" 1440x900 monitor now serves as a secondary monitor.
My video card is a GTX 460 SE 1GB, stock clocks.
The 25" is plugged via an HDMI->DVI cable, and the 19" is VGA.
My secondary monitor sometimes has some kind of jitter/distortion thing going.
Both monitors are at 60Hz
Any idea what I could try to fix this?

item.title: Jittery secondary monitor
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
could be a faulty VGA cable or bad DVI/VGA adapter

Read full topic

item.title: Jittery secondary monitor
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Hmmmm, it seems to do it when my GPU is working hard. But it doesn’t seem to get hot at all.

And the black/white pixel grid doesn’t seem to help much

Read full topic

item.title: Jittery secondary monitor
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
It comes back sometimes after playing something fullscreen and alt-tabbing back

edit: and 30 seconds later it’s back to normal

Read full topic

item.title: Jittery secondary monitor
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Seems to work for now… the problem was on-and-off though, so I’ll see if it comes back…

thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Jittery secondary monitor
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
donwload this image then view in full screen and press auto adjust

https://i155.photobucket.com/albums/s311/sersoft2/untitled-19.png
